TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SoapAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Provides default functionality for all SOAP attributes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SoapAttribute is nonfunctional, and can be used only as the base class for SOAP attributes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
public virtual bool Embedded { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the type must be nested during SOAP serialization.
Docs.value: if the target object must be nested during SOAP serialization; otherwise, .
Docs.returns: if the target object must be nested during SOAP serialization; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: The XML namespace to which the target of the current SOAP attribute is serialized.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can get or set the value of the ProtXmlNamespace field through the public <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.SoapAttribute.XmlNamespace%2A> property.

Docs.summary: A reflection object used by attribute classes derived from the class to set XML serialization information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You do not need to use the ReflectInfo field directly.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool UseAttribute { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the target of the current attribute will be serialized as an XML attribute instead of an XML field.
Docs.value: if the target object of the current attribute must be serialized as an XML attribute; if the target object must be serialized as a subelement.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, if a field `FieldA` of an object `ObjectB` is qualified with the `SoapFieldAttribute(UseAttribute=true)` attribute, `FieldA` will be serialized as `<ObjectB><FieldA>5</FieldA></ObjectB>`. If the UseAttribute property is set to `false`, `FieldA` will be serialized as `<ObjectB FieldA="5"></ObjectB>`.

Docs.returns: if the target object of the current attribute must be serialized as an XML attribute; if the target object must be serialized as a subelement.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string XmlNamespace { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the XML namespace name.
Docs.value: The XML namespace name under which the target of the current attribute is serialized.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the current property returns `null`, then the namespace is not qualified.

Docs.returns: The XML namespace name under which the target of the current attribute is serialized.
